title: Mission Description
content: Led by the messenger, Qingque, you arrive at the Divination Commission, which is responsible for calculation and information management in Xianzhou. The eaves of this building build upon each other like rising mountain peaks and exude an aura of mystique.More mysterious still is the fact that the Commission's doors are shut and show no signs of being prepared for guests, and even Qingque is shut out despite being a staff member.

speaker: Qingque
line: Just a heads up — please don't go running off once we're inside.

speaker: Qingque
line: You may be the master diviner's guests, but she hates people who don't abide by rules and regulations, oh — and people who ask too many questions, not to mention... *sigh* Please don't push her buttons.

speaker: Welt
line: We're just here for the questioning. We'll leave as soon as it's over.

speaker: Qingque
line: ...So strange.

speaker: March 7th
line: Let me guess, the gate isn't working?

speaker: Qingque
line: I don't understand, it's never been locked before... And no one told me to take a key.

speaker: Qingque
line: Hey! I know the food here sucks but that's no reason to shut the gate on our guests!

speaker: March 7th
line: Are you really from the Divination Commission?

text: Is it possible you were... fired?

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: No way — she's already demoted me to managing the repository. What else does she want from me?

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: Don't scare me! Master diviner wouldn't let anything bad happen on her watch.

speaker: Qingque
line: There's no need to panic, okay? This isn't the only entrance into the Divination Commission. I know an emergency access.

text: Follow Qingque to the Divination Commission's side entrance
(Approach the path to the side gate)

speaker: Qingque
line: Here it is.

speaker: March 7th
line: You seem familiar — is this where you come to avoid doing work?

speaker: Qingque
line: You're pretty sharp. Divination Commission staff call this the "loafing gate."

speaker: Qingque
line: When there's nothing to do, we often sneak out from here and spend a few hours lazing around outside.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...A few hours? *sigh* Do you have any vacancies?

speaker: Qingque
line: Ugh, this Stellaron corrosion... what's going on?

speaker: Qingque
line: Great, this gate won't open either. We've kept the master diviner waiting — no doubt she'll blame "unreliable Qingque" for messing up once again...

speaker: March 7th
line: I knew I'd offended that diviner — that's why she sent this girl to help us!

speaker: Welt
line: Miss Qingque, if you don't mind, may I take a look?

speaker: Qingque
line: Huh? Oh, uh... no need. Actually I was just being polite, I don't see why not.

speaker: Qingque
line: Let me show you — this thing is pretty fun.

text: Unlock the side entrance with Qingque's hints

html_content:
Repair
(Displays Abacus Circuitry Tutorial)
The jade abacus substrate system developed by the Artisanship Commission. Move the computing modules with subroutines stored in them to bases with corresponding patterns, so that the substrate can function normally.
The jade abacus substrate system developed by the Artisanship Commission. Move the computing modules with subroutines stored in them to bases with corresponding patterns, so that the substrate can function normally.
(Interactive tutorial)
This is a computing module that can be moved
Select the axis base to move the computing modules around it.
Move all the computing modules to the corresponding bases to make the substrate function normally

speaker: Qingque
line: Wow, you're amazing Mr. Yang! You handled that well for an outsider. I officially hand over the title of "keeper of the loafing gate" to you!

text: Go with Qingque to meet Fu Xuan

title: Step Description
content: Though you are guests, you are now breaking down locks and gates like a group of thieves. However, there is no point in being polite when trouble is at your door.The remaining diviners in the Divination Commission are all worried for their own skins. The variables brought by the Stellaron had far surpassed the limits of the Commission's calculation capacities. Now is the time to ask the master diviner about her plans.

speaker: March 7th
line: *sigh* Anyone here surprised? Anyone?

speaker: Welt
line: Here comes trouble.

speaker: March 7th
line: Ugh, can't we run around to them for a change!?

text: (Enter battle againstMara-Struck Soldier×1,Disciples of Sanctus Medicus: Internal Alchemist×2)
(Approach twoCloud Knightsstanding guard on long path to the right, optional)

speaker: On-Duty Cloud Knight
line: I'm sorry, the Cloud Knights have orders from the master diviner to secure the commission's safety. The area up ahead is temporarily closed.

speaker: Mingyue
line: Wow, a rare honor.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...Me? Have we met?

speaker: Mingyue
line: No, I meant Qingque. I didn't expect to see her here during work hours.

speaker: Qingque
line: That's unfair — I'm working hard! Look, these are the guests the master diviner wants to meet.

speaker: Mingyue
line: A rare honor.

speaker: March 7th
line: Are you talking about us this time?

speaker: Mingyue
line: Yes! The master diviner rarely allows outsiders — she likes her peace and quiet.

speaker: Mingyue
line: If you want to see the master diviner, head straight to the Matrix of Prescience.

speaker: Mingyue
line: They're short of hands — the master diviner is run off her feet and the Cloud Knights stationed there are driving away evil spirits. I don't know when they'll be done.

speaker: Qingque
line: This is the Matrix of Prescience — a large-scale jade abacus calculation terminal. It's the pride and joy of the Divination Commission.

speaker: Welt
line: We've heard the term "jade abacus" a few times now. Would you mind explaining what it is, Miss Qingque?

speaker: Qingque
line: A jade abacus is just... a jade abacus!

speaker: Qingque
line: Eh-he, that's a good question, Mr. Yang — it might take me a minute to give you an answer. Let me think...

speaker: Qingque
line: The book Glimpses Into the Beyond describes it as "living jade engraved with symbols for divination into the unknown."

speaker: Qingque
line: Just like engraving a seal, the craftsmen of the Xianzhou Artisanship Commission carve faint symbols into pieces of jade, and then insert them into machines to get them to operate according to a certain intention.

speaker: Qingque
line: Some jade abacuses are small enough to fit inside bracelets and jewelry. We put the bigger ones into instruments of calculation so we can simulate the future and learn from the past.

speaker: Qingque
line: Take the Matrix of Prescience here as an example. As long as sufficient information is provided, it can answer questions on anything — from the evolution of natural phenomena to the metabolism of living things.

speaker: Qingque
line: They say the theory behind the symbols was handed down by Nous , the Wisdomwalker. The principles are so profound that in the Divination Commission only the master diviner truly understands them.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Seems like it, but "jade abacus" does sound a lot better.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Besides, ordinary computers don't have cool backstories. Technology handed down from Nous, huh...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Even in Madam Herta 's space station , I never saw anything related to Nous.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: It sounds like similar technology. Maybe we'll get a better understanding if we see the manufacturing process with our own eyes.

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: I'm afraid that's impossible — the Artisanship Commission 's Hall of Jadeology keeps a close watch over the jade carving process.

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: But if you're interested, there's a shop selling jade abacus jewelry in Starskiff Haven — I can show you around when I'm free.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ▶ Did you hear that, (Trailblazer)? She said she's taking Mr. Yang jewelry shopping. Hehe, that'll be interesting.

speaker: Qingque
line: Anyway, don't dwell on names. As long as the machine works, what does it matter whether it's a "jade abacus" or a "computer"?

speaker: Qingque
line: Just like today — would it have mattered if "Baique" had brought you here instead of Qingque? It makes no difference at all.

speaker: Qingque
line: We're almost at the Matrix of Prescience core. The master diviner should be waiting.

speaker: Jingzhai
line: Hmm. Meta algorithm reading complete, inputting jade abacus for simulation.

speaker: Jingzhai
line: Divination inference complete, hexagrammatic position established. Fluctuation range is between the marsh and water trigrams. Error margin of 0.2%.

speaker: Jingzhai
line: The algorithm is correct. So what's interfering with the instruments...?

text: (Approach Fu Xuan and the hologram of Jing Yuan)

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Diviner Fu, how are things progressing?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: We're fluctuating between the heaven and thunder trigrams. A step forward bridges no distance hence.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: ...And for those who don't speak Fu Xuan?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Ahem... it's an utter disaster . How's that for a Divination Commission fortune?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: The Matrix of Prescience has stopped operating and the symbols have dimmed. There are Stellaron spirits wreaking havoc inside the commission and the Cloud Knights are struggling to protect civilians. I want to restore the Matrix of Prescience but I have no forces available.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: And on top of all that, General, we still have to deal with the Stellaron Hunter you handed to us. If that's not an utter disaster, then I don't know what is.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Haha, but you're Fu Xuan the seer — the boundless omniscient! Bringing luck and avoiding misfortune is your strong suit, isn't it?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: You don't need to flatter me, General. It's natural for fortune to fluctuate — there's no escaping it.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: The Divination Commission simply does its best to uncover the good and the bad and then make the right decisions. We have no magical means to turn the tide.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: And that is precisely why we need you in charge. When it comes to handling clairvoyant Stellaron Hunters , who better than Fu Xuan the seer? As for reinforcements, you didn't think I'd be unprepared, did you?

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Look, help has just arrived.

speaker: Qingque
line: Master Diviner, I've brought you the guests, though... it wasn't your order I received.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: *sigh* So, general... even guests are on the payroll these days?

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Well, since they're here already, I may as well make use of them.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Entering the Matrix of Prescience without my permission is a breach of protocol...

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: *sigh* ...would be an ungracious thing to say in the present circumstances. I admit, I'm pleasantly surprised to see you here.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Qingque is often unreliable, but she comes through for us when the need arises.

text: Glad to have us as your errand runners, aren't you?

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: It's nice to have people I can entrust with difficult matters. I'm not like the general, and you don't even belong to my commission — I certainly won't be bossing you around.

text: I thought you were going to have us escorted out.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: I was waiting for the Matrix of Prescience to resume operations so that you might gain insight into my divination techniques... *sigh* It was rude of me to keep you waiting so long.

speaker: March 7th
line: No need for the formalities, we heard what the general said... If you need something from us, just say the word.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Very well, then I'll keep this brief. The Divination Commission is currently understaffed. I need your help to restart the Matrix of Prescience's base terminals... and eliminate the Stellaron spirits along the way.

text: Won't we be breaching Xianzhou secrets in the process?

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Yes, but you needn't worry. You have my permission.

text: I don't know anything about this Matrix of Prescience.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Qingque will accompany you. She'll be in charge of restarting the terminal. As for eliminating the spirits...

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Psst, (Trailblazer)... I hath divined our future — we're destined to be errand runners forever...

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: ...Wh—What? Which magic word?

speaker: March 7th
line: *sigh* The universal one: "please."

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Ugh... Please!

speaker: March 7th
line: Good enough.

text: Help the Divination Commission to restart the Matrix of Prescience's three base terminals

title: Step Description
content: Jing Yuan postulates that ordinary interrogations will not be effective in learning the true motive of the Stellaron Hunters. Such a goal can only be achieved using the computational algorithm named Matrix of Prescience in the Divination Commission, which can examine the past and future and calculate the truth.Now, the three great base terminals of the Matrix of Prescience are once again in motion. All is ready for the "interrogation."

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Qingque, restarting the base terminals will be your responsibility.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Oh, and forget everything you saw and heard just now.

speaker: Qingque
line: Is this what I get? No reward and a bunch of extra work...

speaker: Qingque
line: *sigh* The master diviner wants me to restart the Matrix of Prescience's base terminals... and bring you along for the ride.

text: I sense a promotion and a raise!

speaker: Qingque
line: Ugh, I worked so hard on getting transferred to the repository — it's the best place to slack off and be invisible.

speaker: Qingque
line: Now I actually have career prospects... this is terrible.

speaker: Qingque
line: If I screw it up, they might fire me... but if I get it done right, they'll send me more work!

speaker: Qingque
line: I'm gonna ask more questions next time... I could be playing celestial jade right now.

speaker: Qingque
line: I'm gonna ask more questions next time... I could be playing celestial jade right now.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: It's been a while, my astral guests.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Thanks to you, the Luofu has successfully brought Kafka to justice... I am truly grateful — there hadn't been a single Stellaron Hunter arrest since the Interastral Peace Corporation issued their bounty. Hehe, this is a victory for the Xianzhou.

text: So, are you guys and the IPC in direct competition?

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: How can we compete when our paths diverge? The Alliance has taken an oath to hunt down undying abominations, while the IPC is dedicated to their " preservation ." The Alliance and the Corporation occasionally work together, but ultimately, our ways are different.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Still, it's a pleasure for me to be able to say that the Xianzhou has captured a criminal wanted by the IPC, haha.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Still...

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Once this is over and the Stellaron curse has been lifted, the Xianzhou will have no more use for Kafka. If you wish to claim the bounty, feel free to take her to the IPC — the Alliance has no interest in the IPC's reward.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Blade , on the other hand, is a wanted criminal for the Xianzhou — he must remain with us.

text: You didn't give us the full picture of your plan for Kafka.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Fu Xuan's Matrix of Prescience was able to go one step further than Kafka. To maintain the upper hand, I had to keep it a surprise. I hope this hasn't made you doubt my sincerity?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Next time, maybe ease off on the surprises?

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: I promise to be more transparent next time.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: At present, Kafka has no intention of speaking and the Stellaron Hunters' motives remain unknown. We must rely on the power of the Divination Commission to unearth the truth.

speaker: Welt
line: "Unearth the truth..." You mean interrogate Kafka with the Matrix of Prescience?

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Precisely, the Matrix of Prescience is the Divination Commission's ultimate weapon. It was originally used to calculate navigation routes and predict future events...

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: ...but the secrets of the Stellaron Hunters cannot remain hidden any longer. I have no choice but to move beyond conventional protocol — we must use divination to ascertain Kafka's intent.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Everything hinges on restoring the Matrix of Prescience, which is why I would like you to help Diviner Fu complete the setup. I am eternally grateful for your assistance.

text: (Upon approaching the Shifting Screen to the Temporal Terminal, unlock theShifting Screen Tutorial)

speaker: Qingque
line: Let me see, this is the Temporal Terminal.

speaker: Qingque
line: "Observes the potential of the temporal plane." They say this terminal is designed to retrieve information related to time.

text:
(Upon activating the base terminal, unlock theMutare Magnus Tutorial)
(After completing the puzzle)

speaker: Qingque
line: That should do it.

speaker: March 7th
line: What? You just matched up those symbols. Is that it?

speaker: Qingque
line: The more complex something is, the more important it is to keep it simple. Don't you think?

speaker: March 7th
line: If it's so simple, why didn't your master diviner come and do it herself?

speaker: Qingque
line: Hehe, maybe deep down she just wants to be lazy once in a while — like me!

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: I will guard the Matrix core. Once we've restarted the three terminals, Kafka's interrogation can commence.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: When we're finished, I'll give you enough time to talk to her.

text: What happens when you activate the Matrix of Prescience?

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Once activated, the Matrix of Prescience analyzes all the information contained in the target — Kafka in this case — and transfers anything pertaining to the Xianzhou into the diviner's consciousness.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Every one of us walks a Path, moving ceaselessly through time and space, creating all manner of karma in our wake...

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: How are things progressing? I have yet to sense the connection between the three base terminals.

text: Why not use it to calculate the location of the Stellaron?

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Divination is no mere conjecture. If the parameters are insufficient and uncertainty surrounds the target, then it is like looking for a needle in a galaxy. Do you understand?

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Furthermore, interference caused by the Stellaron spirits that infiltrated the Commission has greatly reduced the accuracy of our divination. The margin of error could be as high as 0.2%! I cannot tolerate such inaccuracies in our interpretations.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: So, have you activated the terminals yet? Why is the Matrix of Prescience still unresponsive?

text: What if its calculations are incorrect?

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: There is no "what if"! ...Because nothing remains unforeseen.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: The Matrix's algorithm is known as "the way of all change" — it accounts for every unpredictability on the Path of all things with uncountable enumerations. When your objects of measure are eras of time and oceans of stars, there are no true variables in the world.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: ...No more questions! Have you activated the three terminals!?

text: Say no more. Seriously, please don't say anything else.

speaker: March 7th
line: What the heck is this? It looks like a walking gate...

speaker: Qingque
line: Take it easy, there's nothing supernatural on the Xianzhou. It's an aurumaton — it's guarding the Matrix of Prescience. They're stationed at various strategic places.

speaker: March 7th
line: I feel like it needs a sign saying "mortals forbidden" or something... Are you sure it won't fly into a rage if we walk past it?

speaker: Qingque
line: We're here by order of the master diviner to restart the Matrix of Prescience — friends not foes.

speaker: Malfunctioning Aurumaton
line: Passage... prohibited...!

speaker: Qingque
line: Ah...! March, you should join the Divination Commission! Q—Quick, do something!

speaker: Qingque
line: This must be the Spatial Terminal. They say this terminal is designed to retrieve information related to space. You probably could've guessed that...

speaker: March 7th
line: Let me guess — time, karma... I bet the next terminal is energy-related!

speaker: Qingque
line: Darn, the Spatial Terminal. They say this terminal is designed to retrieve information related to space. You probably could've guessed that...

text: (After completing the puzzle, if the Spatial Terminal puzzle is completed first)

speaker: Qingque
line: Done, next.

text: (If the Spatial Terminal puzzle is completed second, continue to next step)

speaker: Qingque
line: This must be the Karma Terminal. They say this terminal is designed to establish the causal relationships between objects.

speaker: March 7th
line: Let me guess — time, space... I bet the next terminal is energy-related!

speaker: Qingque
line: Darn, the Karma Terminal. They say this terminal is designed to establish causal relationships.

text: (After completing the puzzle, if the Karma Terminal puzzle is completed first)

speaker: Qingque
line: Done, next.

text: (If the Karma Terminal puzzle is completed second, continue to next step)
Return to the Matrix core and report to Fu Xuan

speaker: Qingque
line: Phew, we did it. All three terminals activated.

speaker: Qingque
line: Let's go back to the core and report to the master diviner.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Well done, all of you. I can sense the Matrix of Prescience symbols re-illuminating.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Now, to interrogate Kafka. Those of you in the core may feel a few... impacts.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Are you ready?

text: (Kafka is brought out, flanked by two Cloud Knights)

speaker: Kafka
line: Is this really necessary? I said I'd cooperate with you.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: I have no interest in the words of wanted criminals — especially those skilled in the art of manipulation...

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: ...so say what you will — I'm here to witness the divination of the Matrix of Prescience.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: The Divination Commission has ways of extracting the truth, and they're far more effective than a conversation.

speaker: Kafka
line: Then please, Master Diviner, witness my destiny.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Rise!

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: That's... why you're here?

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: ...All for that?

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Well? Not what you were expecting?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: I can't believe it...

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: ...But, the Matrix of Prescience cannot be wrong.

text: Has Kafka pulled one over on us again?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Kafka has nothing to do with the Stellaron, but you... It's you...

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Ha! Absurd! I'd never have thought it...

text: I sense more Fu Xuan riddles on the horizon...

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Ask her yourself — take as long as you wish.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: I must report this to the general immediately. Please excuse me!

speaker: Welt
line: ▶ ...(Trailblazer), you go ask her.

speaker: Welt
line: I know you still have many questions for Kafka yourself.
